title: Asset management
description_1: Worked in various roles as a data scientist on the energy transition, where I modeled the future state of the network through analyses and predicted investment routes.

title: Grid analytics
description_1: Modeling the impact of the energy transition on the load of the energy network using various techniques such as regression, classification, and machine learning. Participating in data working group RES (regional energy strategy) to create a format to assess the impact of RES scenarios on the energy network. Development and implementation of portfolio optimization. Designing a framework and the necessary software to enable management to choose a risk-based investment portfolio. Participating in various working groups for network operators, such as MORGAN (MOet Regulering Gasnetten ANders) and iNET (integral Network and Energy System of the Future).

title: Risk manager
description_1: Responsible for assessing risks of the gas asset portfolio via the ISO5001 framework by creating models to uniformly assess the risk of the complex system. Building a monitoring system for predicting gas pipeline failure due to subsidence using satellite data. Working on the design, implementation, and monitoring of measures to ensure asset quality. Translating quality measures for assets into investment planning. For example, the development of sensors for the cathodic protection system for steel pipelines.
